title: Ticket #6959: A non-rootly master should not try and modify the windows firewall
description:
the condor_master on Windows will attempt to alter the Windows firewall when it starts up. This attempt will always fail if the master is not running with sufficient priviledge, and is something that only needs to be done once. The master should only attempt to do this if it is running as local system, but the default value of the knob in the param table forces it to try even when not running as local system.

The default in the param table should be changed from true to $(CondorIsAdmin).
check_ins: 2019-Mar-19 09:39   Check-in [56381]: change param table so that a non-rootly condor will not try and alter the windows firewall. #6959 ===VersionHistory:None=== this change will only affect testing, not actual installs of HTCondor on Windows. (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
